body_html: Many thanks. I read that post. I believe all the dlls are accessible. The issue seems that torch._C is trying to create some file or write to some section of the memory. However, I’m not sure, but have a suspicion that GPO policy might be to blame. I could not simply disable it as my company does not allow it. Thanks anyway. Zhan From: peterjc123 [mailto:notifications@github.com] Sent: 08 August 2018 11:24 To: pytorch/pytorch <pytorch@noreply.github.com> Cc: Cui,Z,Zhan,TUS2 R <zhan.cui@bt.com>; Comment <comment@noreply.github.com> Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] PyTorch ImportError (#9440) Maybe this post<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49127425/how-to-troubleshoot-python-import-error-dll-access-denied> can shed some light on your problem. — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#9440 (comment)>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/Angq9q5bJFEIk_zI9FH_dGFNSjJYCnCYks5uOrxZgaJpZM4VPw0a>.
body_text:
Many thanks.  I read that post.  I believe all the dlls are accessible.  The issue seems that torch._C is trying to create some file or write to some section of the memory.  However, I’m not sure, but have a suspicion that GPO policy might be to blame.  I could not simply disable it as my company does not allow it.

Thanks anyway.

Zhan

From: peterjc123 [mailto:notifications@github.com]
Sent: 08 August 2018 11:24
To: pytorch/pytorch <pytorch@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Cui,Z,Zhan,TUS2 R <zhan.cui@bt.com>; Comment <comment@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] PyTorch ImportError (#9440)


Maybe this post<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49127425/how-to-troubleshoot-python-import-error-dll-access-denied> can shed some light on your problem.

—
You are receiving this because you commented.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#9440 (comment)>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/Angq9q5bJFEIk_zI9FH_dGFNSjJYCnCYks5uOrxZgaJpZM4VPw0a>.
body:
Many thanks.  I read that post.  I believe all the dlls are accessible.  The issue seems that torch._C is trying to create some file or write to some section of the memory.  However, I’m not sure, but have a suspicion that GPO policy might be to blame.  I could not simply disable it as my company does not allow it.

Thanks anyway.

Zhan

From: peterjc123 [mailto:notifications@github.com]
Sent: 08 August 2018 11:24
To: pytorch/pytorch <pytorch@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Cui,Z,Zhan,TUS2 R <zhan.cui@bt.com>; Comment <comment@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] PyTorch ImportError (#9440)


Maybe this post<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49127425/how-to-troubleshoot-python-import-error-dll-access-denied> can shed some light on your problem.
